See,I am creating new heavens & a new earth...No longer shall the sound of weeping be heard there,or the sound of crying...No longer shall there be in it an infant who lives but a few days nor anyone who does not live a full lifetime

Isaiah 65:17-20

Let’s remember that without our farm workers in California and across the country, there would be no food on our tables to get us through this pandemic. I’m grateful for their work, not just today but every day.

This is sick & twisted. Rand has contracted coronavirus; in 2017, in a violent criminal attack, he suffered 6 broken ribs, pneumonia & had part of his lung removed—all of which puts him at much greater risk from this deadly virus—and you’re siding w/ the attacker? #LoveEachOther https://twitter.com/sfpelosi/status/1241871541597437952 QT @sfpelosi Rand Paul’s neighbor was right https://twitter.com/pkcapitol/status/1241843197246128133

RT @ABCPolitics Speaker Nancy Pelosi introduces Democratic coronavirus relief bill as negotiations stall in the Senate: “We require that any corporation that takes taxpayer dollars must protect their workers’ wages and benefits — not CEO pay, stock buybacks or layoffs.” https://trib.al/uB01jbY http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ET0F5c2WoAMMawA.jpg

Today has been a really ugly day here in the Senate. 

We are wrapping up some minor issues on the portion of the deal I have been negotiating.

I have reason to believe tomorrow will be a much better day.

It better be.

I don’t think America can take another day like this. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1242251813891514370/pu/img/WZ3b-4EJAbQubblT.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1242251813891514370/pu/vid/320x568/08zu8ox0uc7oOfyb.mp4?tag=10

Any stimulus must support workers’ payroll and benefits—not enrich wealthy executives of giant corporations. If we want to weather this crisis, we need to build the economy from the grassroots up. https://www.npr.org/2020/03/23/820009349/sen-warren-explains-why-she-voted-against-stimulus-plan

Loosening restrictions on public activity right now—when we’re in the midst of a public health crisis—would only get more Americans sick and add more time to our economic recovery. We can’t afford to ignore public health experts on this. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-signals-growing-weariness-with-social-distancing-and-other-steps-advocated-by-health-officials/2020/03/23/0920ea0a-6cfc-11ea-a3ec-70d7479d83f0_story.html

Right now millions of Americans are waking up in the middle of the night, worried sick they’ll lose the roof over their head as a result of this crisis. 

Congress must ban evictions, foreclosures, and repossessions until this pandemic is over.
Kelley and I, wish John a speedy recovery.  http://www.startribune.com/sen-amy-klobuchar-s-husband-hospitalized-with-covid-19-coronavirus/569026412/

Collins voted for the GOP tax scam.
She voted to appoint Kavanaugh.
She’s defending an utterly corrupt bill to shower public money on friends and donors.

Susan Collins is not a moderate. She just plays one on TV.

Rise above.
Rise above partisanship.
Rise above the bickering that so often consumes Washington.

RT @byron_auguste Restaurant staff, grocery clerks, health aides, sanitation workers, etc., are low-wage—not low-skill.

They do quality control, optimize time tradeoffs, navigate social-emotional dynamics.

And in the midst of #COVID19, they are making major sacrifices to keep our society afloat.

We not only need to put a moratorium on utility shut-offs across the country. We must restore utility services to anyone who has had their utilities shut off.

👨🏽‍⚕️Guaranteed coverage for preexisting conditions

I urge the @USChamber to end their lobbying efforts against the DPA & get to work to fight this public health & economic crisis.

Our economy is made up of working people like cashiers, domestic workers, farm workers, small business owners, truck drivers, and teachers.

Yes, Congress must take major action to help our economy. But our focus must be on helping working people—not CEOs and Wall Street.

There were at least 6,484 new cases in the US.
There were at least 102 deaths in the US.
There was another death in TX.

RT @GovHerbert As missionaries return home due to the spread of COVID-19 across the globe, they should not be met by big groups of family or friends. Large welcome parties are dangerous and could greatly increase the spread of coronavirus in our state.

Monthly cash payments.
Paid family and sick leave.
Student loan forgiveness.
Ban on all evictions and foreclosures.
 
These are the things the Senate should be prioritizing to help Americans who are hurting right now—not corporate handouts.

What you are watching in Senate right now is just a bunch of posturing to protect their leverage in negotiations. 

Given all the economic suffering people are facing I simply can’t imagine we end today without passing a deal. We must suspend rent and mortgage payments, evictions, and foreclosures across the country. We cannot abandon our people and allow families to be thrown out of their homes during a pandemic. https://twitter.com/byHeatherLong/status/1241811658709831681 QT @byHeatherLong NEW: Many Americans' biggest worry right now is how to pay their rent or mortgage -- due April 1.

Gov checks won't begin arriving until April 6 (if then)
Median rent = $1,600
Median mortgage = $1,400

https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/03/22/april-rent-due-coronavirus/ w/@renaemerle

10 years ago the #AffordableCareAct became law providing health care for over 20 million Americans & protecting 135 million with preexisting conditions. Even in the #COVID19 crisis, Trump is still trying to terminate the ACA & has no plan to replace it. We must keep up the fight. https://twitter.com/ddale8/status/1241869216460034048 QT @ddale8 Noted that his administration supports a lawsuit to eradicate the Affordable Care Act, and asked if he'd reconsider given that people are losing jobs/need health care, Trump says what they're doing is working to "get rid of the bad health care and put in a great health care."

This is truly outrageous. Congress needs to be working urgently to protect the health of the American people—not threatening the health care of millions of low-income people. https://twitter.com/ThePlumLineGS/status/1242098670759219200 QT @ThePlumLineGS NEW:

Dems have found a measure that Rs buried in the stimulus that would restrict small business money from going to a range of health care providers that take Medicaid.

This includes providers for the disabled and even rape crisis centers.

New piece:

https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/03/23/gop-just-smuggled-another-awful-provision-into-big-stimulus-bill/
I'll be talking with @SRuhle on MSNBC soon about the Senate stimulus package & why I'm fighting for a grassroots stimulus that directly helps hospitals, small businesses, & working families. Tune in.

RT @SenSherrodBrown Small businesses and families shouldn't be worrying about being harassed by debt collectors or charged huge fees.

I'm introducing a bill with @SenWarren and @SenBooker to protect workers and small businesses from debt collectors during this crisis. 

https://www.banking.senate.gov/newsroom/minority/brown-senate-democrats-introduce-new-legislation-to-protect-consumers-and-small-business-owners-from-debt-collection

RT @MayorOfLA The COVID-19 crisis is no time to play politics with people's lives. Emergency resources must be available to everyone impacted, regardless of immigration status. That is why I stand with @SenKamalaHarris in supporting the Pandemic Disaster Assistance Act.

RT @MassGovernor Today I issued an emergency order requiring all businesses and organizations that do not provide #COVID19 essential services to close their physical workplaces and facilities to workers, customers and the public.

Eviction, foreclosure, & shut-off suspensions are good but they are nowhere near enough.

People don’t want to be in the position where the moment the orders are lifted there will be a marshal at their door. They still feel like rent is due unless a payment moratorium is called.
Live soon→ I’ll be discussing the latest federal #COVID19 response efforts with @D2KSL on @KSLnewsradio. Tune in: https://kslnewsradio.com/listen/

The consequences of the coronavirus on people already suffering from war are truly unimaginable.

Humanity should end its conflicts and killing right now, and come together to save lives.

The United States can and must play a leading role in bringing about a global ceasefire. https://twitter.com/antonioguterres/status/1242155073981087744 QT @antonioguterres Today I am calling for an immediate global ceasefire in all corners of the world.

It is time to put armed conflict on lockdown and focus together on the true fight of our lives – the #COVID19 pandemic.

https://www.un.org/sg/en/content/sg/statement/2020-03-23/secretary-generals-appeal-for-global-ceasefire http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ET0FQhvWkAEZSds.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1242153786531086339/vid/320x320/YDOhwsCZFWb-YrJ7.mp4?tag=13

.@SenatorCollins can keep her crocodile tears.

She voted & fought HARD to strip pandemic prep funding. She helped drive the lack of preparation that we had leading up to this.

The ordinarily calm @SenatorCollins is railing against Dems for delaying consideration of coronavirus package: "This is disgraceful."

“We don’t have another day! We don’t have another hour. We don’t have another minute to delay acting.”

Don’t want to even contemplate the economic carnage that will be inflicted on millions of workers & families if the Senate doesn’t reach a deal & pass it today.

The importance of most of the disagreements as of midnight pale in comparison to the consequences of failure

Because of the #ACA:
- Millions of people with pre-existing conditions can no longer be denied coverage.
- Tens of millions of uninsured people have gained insurance.
- And countless others have high quality care that covers essential health benefits and preventive care.

On Saturday, our campaign began mobilizing volunteers for COVID community check-in calls.

Vols are connected via Zoom party & trained to help our NY-14 neighbors.

We were able to call 2,700 neighbors in one day!

Let’s keep it up. Try a shift this week:
https://www.ocasiocortez.com/events

RT @BarackObama Ten years ago today, I signed the Affordable Care Act into law. It protected preexisting conditions, cut the uninsured rate in half, and lots more. But it's still under political attack right when we need care the most. We have to protect it, build on it, until we cover everyone. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETzOTIUWkAEVhHv.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1242086657526030337/vid/480x270/9KTy-TtOimMHhdSz.mp4?tag=13

Without the #ACA, people with preexisting conditions would have difficulty getting the coverage they need to fight the #COVID19 virus—and many of us might not be able to get care now or in the future because of annual and lifetime caps that were allowed before the law was passed.
